revised_title: The Effect of Silver on the Distribution of Base Metals in Gold Alloys
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on gold alloys containing base metals like lead and zinc. They discovered that the presence of silver in the alloy helps in creating a uniform distribution of gold, making it easier to estimate the value of the ingots. The study suggests that when the base metal content does not exceed 30%, silver can dissolve it and form a uniform alloy with gold.
